snippet: Officials said that they would consider an expansion of bond-buying if conditions warranted, and added that federal budget cuts were hurting the economy.
abstract: Federal Reserve says that its economic stimulus campaign will continue at same pace it has maintained since Dec 2012, putting to rest speculation that it was leaning toward scaling back; officials emphasize they are ready to increase or decrease efforts to spur growth and reduce unemployment as necessary, more balanced approach than it took earlier in year.
lead_paragraph: Officials said that they would consider an expansion of bond-buying if conditions warranted, and added that federal budget cuts were hurting the economy.

headline.seo: Fed Stands By Stimulus, and Says It’s Open to More
headline.main: More Forceful Fed Stands by Stimulus
headline.print_headline: More Forceful Fed Stands By Stimulus
